alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 8:38AM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...The lower Kankakee River just upstream of the Illinois River. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Localized flooding of low lying areas and property along the river may occur upstream and downstream of the ice jam. Rapid water level fluctuations may occur due to heavy ice cover on the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Will County Emergency Management and ice spotters report an ice jam downstream of Wilmington has begun to shift and break up. If the ice jam were to break up quickly, flash flooding would occur downstream of the jam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rain showers on frozen ground and due to river ice is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Grundy and Southern Will. * WHEN...Until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of some rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms will continue to move over northern Illinois and northwest Indiana this morning with an additional half inch of rain possible by noon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
